articles.description: All the latest football news plus reaction to Tuesday's EFL Cup third-round ties and the Women's Nations League.
articles.title: Women's Nations League & EFL Cup reaction

articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has admitted he has failed to get the best out of Kalvin Phillips since signing him from Leeds United.
articles.title: I've failed to get best out of Phillips - Guardiola

articles.description: England captain Millie Bright says it is "mind-blowing" that the video assistant referee was not used in their Women's Nations League defeat by the Netherlands.
articles.title: No VAR in England loss is 'mind-blowing' - Bright

articles.description: Since Todd Boehly became chairman, Chelsea have spent £185m on buying players from Brighton - as well as taking seven members of their staff. Has it worked out?
articles.title: How have Chelsea's Brighton moves worked out?

articles.description: Luke Donald changes Europe's opening strategy at the Ryder Cup with the hope of making a "fast start" as they try to extend a 30-year unbeaten home run against the United States.
articles.title: Europe alter Ryder Cup strategy to chase 'fast start'

articles.description: Henry Arundell will be a "dangerous" Rugby World Cup opponent after five tries against Chile, says England team-mate Jonny May.
articles.title: 'World at Arundell's feet,' says England wing May

articles.description: Victor Osimhen's agent Roberto Calenda says they could take legal action against Napoli after the club mocked the striker in a video on social media.
articles.title: Osimhen agent threatens legal action against Napoli

articles.description: Manchester United begin their Carabao Cup title defence with a comfortable 3-0 victory over Crystal Palace at Old Trafford to reach the fourth round.
articles.title: Man Utd beat Palace to reach EFL Cup fourth round

articles.description: After Friday's disappointment in England, relief was the dominant emotion for Scotland after their draw with Belgium.
articles.title: 'Relief for Scots after missed Hampden opportunity'

articles.description: BBC Sport visits Stamford Bridge to explore Chelsea's recruitment strategy, the club's unprecedented spending spree, and the ambitions of chairman Todd Boehly.
articles.title: What's the big idea behind Chelsea's £1bn spending spree?
